routine.routineSummary: Get your upper body burning no matter your ability!

exercise.exerciseDescription: With your hands placed a shoulder width apart and a straight back, lower yourself to the ground keeping your elbows tucked in. Hold the position. Then push off of the floor to your start position to complete a rep.
exercise.text: With your hands placed a shoulder width apart and a straight back, lower yourself to the ground keeping your elbows tucked in. Hold the position. Then push off of the floor to your start position to complete a rep.

exercise.exerciseDescription: From a normal push up position, lower yourself down so that your weight is resting on your forearms. With a straight back, hold this position by engaging your core muscles.
exercise.text: From a normal push up position, lower yourself down so that your weight is resting on your forearms. With a straight back, hold this position by engaging your core muscles.

exercise.exerciseDescription: Using a chair, put your weight onto your hands then lower yourself slowly down so that your legs are straight and your body forms an L shape. Push off of the chair to return to your start position to complete a rep.
exercise.text: Using a chair, put your weight onto your hands then lower yourself slowly down so that your legs are straight and your body forms an L shape. Push off of the chair to return to your start position to complete a rep.

exercise.exerciseDescription: Start by laying on your front. Raise your legs off of the floor while simultaneously raising your arms off of the floor using your shoulder and back muscles. Hold this position.
exercise.text: Start by laying on your front. Raise your legs off of the floor while simultaneously raising your arms off of the floor using your shoulder and back muscles. Hold this position.

routine.routineSummary: Get your lower body burning no matter your ability!

exercise.exerciseDescription: From a standing position, space your legs about a shoulder width apart, toes facing forwards and bend at the knee to lower your body. Ensure that you do not arch your back; keep it straight, and bend sufficiently at the knee to lower yourself. Then, raise yourself by engaging leg and core muscles back to the start position to complete a rep.
exercise.text: From a standing position, space your legs about a shoulder width apart, toes facing forwards and bend at the knee to lower your body. Ensure that you do not arch your back; keep it straight, and bend sufficiently at the knee to lower yourself. Then, raise yourself by engaging leg and core muscles back to the start position to complete a rep.

exercise.exerciseDescription: From a standing position, step out in front and lower yourself onto that leg. Ensure that the knee of the leg you stepped out on doesnâ€™t go past your foot and that your back knee doesnâ€™t hit the floor. Engage your leg and core muscles to perform the motion correctly. Push off of the leading le to return to your start position. Repeat using the opposite leg as the leading leg.
exercise.text: From a standing position, step out in front and lower yourself onto that leg. Ensure that the knee of the leg you stepped out on doesnâ€™t go past your foot and that your back knee doesnâ€™t hit the floor. Engage your leg and core muscles to perform the motion correctly. Push off of the leading le to return to your start position. Repeat using the opposite leg as the leading leg.

exercise.exerciseDescription: On flat ground, start flat-footed. Raise yourself up onto the balls of your feet and hold at the top, before lowering back down to the start position to complete a rep.
exercise.text: On flat ground, start flat-footed. Raise yourself up onto the balls of your feet and hold at the top, before lowering back down to the start position to complete a rep.

exercise.exerciseDescription: Using a chair, rest your back onto the seat of the chair and hold yourself level using your legs; feet planted. Then lower your core and glutes towards the floor. Hold this position before engaging your leg muscles and returning to the start position to complete a rep.
exercise.text: Using a chair, rest your back onto the seat of the chair and hold yourself level using your legs; feet planted. Then lower your core and glutes towards the floor. Hold this position before engaging your leg muscles and returning to the start position to complete a rep.

routine.routineSummary: Get your core burning no matter your ability!

exercise.exerciseDescription: From a normal push up position, lower yourself down so that your weight is resting on your forearms. With a straight back, hold this position by engaging your core muscles.
exercise.text: From a normal push up position, lower yourself down so that your weight is resting on your forearms. With a straight back, hold this position by engaging your core muscles.

exercise.exerciseDescription: From laying on your side, raise yourself off the floor using your forearm as an anchor. Keep your legs parallel and engage your core to maintain the position. Switch arms to complete the exercise for the other half of your abdominals.
exercise.text: From laying on your side, raise yourself off the floor using your forearm as an anchor. Keep your legs parallel and engage your core to maintain the position. Switch arms to complete the exercise for the other half of your abdominals.

exercise.exerciseDescription: From laying on your side, raise yourself off the floor using your forearm as an anchor. Keep your legs parallel and engage your core to maintain the position. Switch arms to complete the exercise for the other half of your abdominals.
exercise.text: From laying on your side, raise yourself off the floor using your forearm as an anchor. Keep your legs parallel and engage your core to maintain the position. Switch arms to complete the exercise for the other half of your abdominals.

exercise.exerciseDescription: From a seated position on the floor with your feet planted or raised in the air slightly, rotate the upper half of your body from left to right while maintaining a stable lower body position. Remember to engage your core muscles to maintain form.
exercise.text: From a seated position on the floor with your feet planted or raised in the air slightly, rotate the upper half of your body from left to right while maintaining a stable lower body position. Remember to engage your core muscles to maintain form..

routine.routineSummary: Get your upper body burning - a level up from beginner!

exercise.exerciseDescription: With your hands placed a shoulder width apart and a straight back, lower yourself to the ground keeping your elbows tucked in. Hold the position. Then push off of the floor to your start position to complete a rep.

Ensure that you do not arch your back; keep it straight, and bend sufficiently at the knee to lower yourself. Then, raise yourself by engaging leg and core muscles back to the start position to complete a rep.

exercise.exerciseDescription: Facing towards a step, step up onto it with one foot and bring your opposite foot up onto the step. Now step down using the last foot that stepped up. Repeat this action using alternate feet to do the initial step up motion.
exercise.text: Facing towards a step, step up onto it with one foot and bring your opposite foot up onto the step. Now step down using the last foot that stepped up. Repeat this action using alternate feet to do the initial step up motion.
